intro: Helminthia comosa, commonly known as the hairy false nettle, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound umbellate inflorescences. The plant features finely hairy stems and leaves with a distinctive, serrated margin. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are typically clustered in umbrella-like clusters. Helminthia comosa is often found in moist, disturbed soils along roadsides and in woodland edges.
